top_comment.text:
going to try to make this now, fish guy recommended snapper. I wonder how I 
will mess it up.﻿
top_comment.author: robo2200

comments.text:
Loosen the bottle cap first.  Actually take it off and replace it.  Make 
the noise with your mouth.  That's what I do.
comments.author: DJ BBQ

comments.text:
actually turned out well but the fish didn't have much flavour, next time 
I'll add more spice. Wondering if I should I also try unscrewing a bottle 
using my eye socket?
comments.author: robo2200

comments.text: Snapper sounds good!
comments.author: DJ BBQ

top_comment.text:
Wished his hair hanging into the food didn't turn me off, however, that is 
nasty.. all that hair.  Recipe looks great!﻿
top_comment.author: Carol Blacklaws

comments.text: +DJ BBQ His hair is amazing, wish I had it like that.
comments.author: Lee Dawg

comments.text: I'll wear a hat next time.
comments.author: DJ BBQ

top_comment.text: Love ur recipes Yu rock.. But that kitchen needs serious organizing.... <3﻿
top_comment.author: owsome girl

comments.text: We know where everything is.  haha,  Cheers for the positive vibes.
comments.author: DJ BBQ

comments.text:
I bet he knows exactly where everything is at in that kitchen without even 
looking for it! Looks similar to my house... lived in and used, not a 
museum :) BTW, great vid, loving the tacos!!
comments.author: Calipali1

comments.text: thanks for pointing it out
comments.author: DJ BBQ

top_comment.text:
Some serranos chiles in the mango salsa and we are good.with a nice cold 
Corona ohh men so good...how about next time try to do some ceviche peruano 
would love that ﻿
top_comment.author: Samuel Alay

comments.text:
There are great ceviche's from all over the place.  I've only had ones 
influenced by Peru and Mexico.
comments.author: DJ BBQ

comments.text:
+DJ BBQ ceviche is the best way to go.would love your take on that.i 
mention the Peruvian ceviche because is the best in the world and iam not 
peruvian.in Guatemala we have our own ceviche but nothing beats the one 
from peru..love your videos.
comments.author: Samuel Alay

comments.text:
great idea.. I really wanna do some ceviche recipes.  Been getting into it 
properly this year.
comments.author: DJ BBQ

top_comment.text: What is in a Mexican rub?﻿
top_comment.author: chende62

comments.text: +Doc KB and some smoked paprika.
comments.author: Doc KB

comments.text:
I use..cumin, crushed garlic, chipotle tabasco or ancho chili pepper, a bit 
of onion powder....a bit of olive oil.....
comments.author: Doc KB

top_comment.text: He opens bottle much better than chops with knife!﻿
top_comment.author: Sergey Kopylov

comments.text: +DJ BBQ You are cool anyway!
comments.author: Sergey Kopylov

comments.text: I've gotten better with the knife.  But not much better.
comments.author: DJ BBQ

top_comment.text:
Hey man, I made these the night my mom announced she had cancer. Your food 
lifted everyone's spirits up and we could only talk about how good it was. 
So not only does your food taste damn good, it makes people happy. Now mom 
is kicking cancers as by the way. So keep on rockin and adding those 
chillieeeeees!!!﻿
top_comment.author: Arno Wijno

comments.text:
+Arno Wijno Best wishes to your mom that she gets better. I hope things 
will be ok for you guys.
comments.author: Kyle Hearnsberger

comments.text: Best message of 2014.  Cheers, Arno.  One Love to you and the family.
comments.author: DJ BBQ

top_comment.text:
Food looks great... but I could not cook in that kitchen. It is way too 
cluttered and messy.﻿
top_comment.author: Travis Ross (TwistyTravster)

comments.text:
+DJ BBQ Oh, I'm sure its definitely organized to your liking. I'm just 
saying it would be hard for me to jump into a place like that and be able 
to know where everything is. I know you rock that kitchen without a 
problem; its obvious from your other videos.
comments.author: Travis Ross (TwistyTravster)

comments.text:
+Nancy Brien
there are so many shelves....we just need a bigger kitchen
comments.author: DJ BBQ

comments.text: +Memmay Damon I know, I know. Empty room = empty mind.
comments.author: Travis Ross (TwistyTravster)

comments.text:
Travis, apparently you can't recognize a genius when you see one!  Morons 
run around worried about menial things. lol  You rock James and D.J.! 
Thanks for being so generous! xxoo
comments.author: Memmay Damon

comments.text: +DJ BBQ dude get some shelves lol
comments.author: Nancy Brien

comments.text:
+DJ BBQ I know... most people who cook don't make a ton of money (unless 
they're a professional chef owning their own restaurant). They work 
overtime every week with no holidays off. People who dedicate their lives 
to the cooking industry do it because they love it. So I guess if he loves 
his food and can work around his own kitchen, then all the power to him.
comments.author: Travis Ross (TwistyTravster)

comments.text:
+Dobby
It's true.  We love to cook and my wife is a very good baker so there's 
lots of different tools for our trades.
Plus, raising 3 young boys....It's quite chaotic.
comments.author: DJ BBQ

captions.text: hey im dj bbq and i know a lot of times we are out doors
slow and low cooking big hunks of meat well
not everybody has a bbq not everybody can cook outdoors so we have got something for you
i do fish tacos on a grill bbq style but you can
easily do them on a frying pan on a griddle inside your kitchen so lets do it
fish tacos
we are going to start with
mangoes man, a mango salsa
so we have got a nice riped mango
mango goes killer with fish
can you smell it
wish you could cos it smells awesome int o the bowl randiculousness now we are going to add a red onion onions in
and now its time for cucumber
mix it all up shes looking good
in america we call it cilantro
in England you guys call it coriander im going to shred them
to expose that flavour let that flavout out
and that goes in the salsa
okay so im going to add half a lime
now we have got to season it man salt and fruit
rocks
hence why my grandpa always put salt on his grapefruit
and then you want to add some freshly
cracked pepper
with some love give it a remix
looks good doesn't it
taste better
mango salsa done
now with all fish tacos you have got to do some Mexican cabbage some kind of slaw
i got the smallest red cabbage i could find
i could play basket ball with this bad boy
im going to slice this up real
fine
im going to drizzle
some cider vinegar on said red cabbage
oh god
simple simple slaw red cabbage
cider vinegar
and your good to go
its time now to get cooking
now we got to do the fish
if you guys don't start behaving you are going to end up like the tilapia man you want to use a nice firm fish you also want to use a sustainable fish

we're gonna season tilapia they've been
sitting in cold water when i want to eat
fish tacos i make a mexican rub you know garlic peppers
cumin all sorts of
mexican spice chilli powders and now
that's how i do it im going to break out our mexican rub its got to have a bit of a kick
okay are you guys ready for it to go in the pan
i said are you ready for it to go in the pan
im hungry man

at the same time i'm gonna get another
pan going to heat up
my tortillas add a tiny bit of olive oil
give it two to three minutes a side
normally i cook it outside so it gives it a more smokey flavour coming off the
grill
but you can gook it inside it's fine
so i've got my tortillas
im going to pop them on there
you're going to see it sort of bubbling up that what you want
there right there going in
give it some heat give it some love give it some smoke you want
like thirty second a side
kind of medium to hotter heat
there you have it dj bbq's fish tacos
i cooked them indoors
you can do them out doors wherever man as long as your damn well doing them
lets get into this bad boy
oh my god
that's a proper mosh pit in my mouth
clean refreshing tasty smells good
dont worry boys
you guys are alright
which one of you all up there likes pork
yeah i thought so
then this next one is for you
my radonculous pulled pork shoulder cooked low and slow

title: Kick-ass Fish tacos and Mango Salsa with DJ BBQ
